Legal_Issue: Can the Board vacate a Convention refugee status based on alleged misrepresentation without establishing equivalency between foreign and Canadian criminal laws?
Outcome: The judicial review application is allowed, and the case is remitted to a new panel for re-determination due to insufficient evidence regarding crime equivalency.
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Evidence_Type: Lack of evidence on legal equivalency
Legal_Provision: Section 109 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Section 18.1(4) of the Federal Courts Act
Basis_of_Claim: Alleged misrepresentation about prior convictions in Bulgaria
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Equivalency of foreign crime to Canadian law
Application_Error: Failure to establish equivalency between Bulgarian fraud conviction and Canadian serious non-political crime
Evidence_Ignored: Absence of evidence proving equivalency of foreign conviction
Legal_Standard: Factual findings must be supported by evidence
Application_Factor: Misrepresentation leading to inadmissibility under IRPA
Decision_Outcome: Vacating of refugee status set aside
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s decision was based on sufficient evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: No proof of equivalency between Bulgarian and Canadian criminal laws
Procedural_Fairness: Deficiency in evidentiary support affecting fairness
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board’s factual finding without evidentiary basis
Omission_Type: Failure to provide evidence of crime equivalency

Legal_Issue: Can the Board vacate a Convention refugee status based on a foreign conviction without proving equivalency to Canadian law?
Evidence_Assessment: Board relied on Bulgarian certificates but no evidence of equivalency to Canadian law
Decision_Outcome: Vacating of refugee status found flawed due to lack of equivalency proof
Burden_of_Proof: On Minister to prove equivalency of foreign offense
Legal_Rule: Refugee status can be vacated for fraud or misrepresentation; Article 1F(b) exclusion applies if serious non-political crime
Procedural_Issue: Failure to meet evidentiary requirements for foreign conviction equivalency
Grounds_for_Claim: Applicant concealed criminal conviction in Bulgaria for fraud involving $14,680
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim not sustained due to lack of evidentiary support
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision undermined by lack of procedural fairness in evidentiary evaluation
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Board’s reliance on foreign conviction without equivalency analysis
Standard_of_Proof: Preponderance of evidence required for misrepresentation
Outcome: Case remanded to differently constituted panel
Remedy_Sought: Set aside Board decision and remit for new hearing
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Serious non-political crime via fraud over $5000
Governing_Rule: Equivalency of foreign criminal offenses must be proven with evidence
